verses.text: 到了第八天，摩西把亞倫和他的兒子，以及以色列的眾長老都召了來；

words.note: Used before numbers to form ordinals (e.g., 'first', 'second')
Introduces the object of a verb, often implying disposal or impact.
Used before a noun to mean 'all of the' or 'many'.
Refers to a leader or senior member of a group or community.

verses.text: 摩西對亞倫說：「你要取一頭公牛犢來作贖罪祭，一隻公綿羊作燔祭，兩樣都要沒有殘疾的；獻在耶和華的面前。

words.note: A sacrifice offered to atone for sin.
A sacrifice completely consumed by fire.
Transliteration of the Hebrew name for God (YHWH).

verses.text: 你也要告訴以色列人：你們要取一隻公山羊作贖罪祭，又取一頭一歲的牛犢和一隻一歲的綿羊羔作燔祭，兩樣都要沒有殘疾的；

words.note: A sacrifice offered to atone for sin.
A sacrifice completely consumed by fire.

verses.text: 又取一頭公牛和一隻公綿羊作平安祭，宰獻在耶和華面前；又取用油調和的素祭，因為今天耶和華要向你們顯現。」

words.note: An offering for fellowship and thanksgiving with God.
Transliteration of the Hebrew name for God (YHWH).
An offering of flour, grain, or bread, often with oil and frankincense.
Transliteration of the Hebrew name for God (YHWH).

verses.text: 於是他們把摩西所吩咐的，帶到會幕前面；全體會眾都走近來，站在耶和華的面前。

words.note: Introduces the object of a verb, often implying disposal or impact.
Forms a nominal phrase referring to 'what was (verb-ed)'.
The portable sanctuary used by the Israelites in the wilderness.
Refers to a gathering of people for religious purposes.
Transliteration of the Hebrew name for God (YHWH).

verses.text: 摩西說：「這是耶和華吩咐你們的事，你們要照著行，耶和華的榮耀就要向你們顯現。」

words.note: Often means 'God's command' in biblical context.

verses.text: 然後摩西對亞倫說：「走到祭壇那裡，獻上你的贖罪祭和燔祭，為自己和人民贖罪；又獻上人民的供物，按著耶和華的吩咐，為他們贖罪。」

words.note: A sacrifice for atonement of sins.
An offering completely consumed by fire.
To make amends for wrongdoing.

verses.text: 於是亞倫走近祭壇，宰殺那為自己獻的贖罪祭牛犢。
verses.heading: The Sin Offering for the Priests

verses.text: 亞倫的兒子奉上血，他就把手指蘸在血裡，抹在祭壇的四角上，把剩下的血倒在祭壇腳那裡；

words.note: Refers to the corners/horns of the altar.

verses.text: 贖罪祭牲的脂肪、腎和肝葉，他都焚燒在祭壇上，都是照著耶和華吩咐摩西的。

words.note: Indicates a nominalized phrase or emphasis.

verses.text: 至於肉和皮，卻在營外用火燒掉。
亞倫宰殺了燔祭牲，他的兒子把血遞給他，潑在祭壇的周圍。

words.note: An animal designated for burnt offering.

verses.heading: The Burnt Offering for the Priests

verses.text: 他們跟著把燔祭牲一塊一塊連頭遞給他，焚燒在祭壇上。

words.note: An animal designated for burnt offering.
焚 often implies burning for ritual or destruction.
Used here as a locative suffix.

verses.text: 亞倫又洗淨了內臟和腿，在祭壇的燔祭上焚燒。

words.note: Used here as a locative suffix.
焚 often implies burning for ritual or destruction.

verses.text: 他把人民的供物獻上，又把那為人民作贖罪祭的公山羊牽來，宰殺了，獻為贖罪祭，和先前獻的一樣。

words.note: A sacrifice for atonement of sins.
A sacrifice for atonement of sins.
Functions to nominalize the preceding phrase.

verses.heading: The Offerings for the People

verses.text: 然後他按著規則獻上燔祭，

words.note: Specifically for offering sacrifices or tribute.

verses.text: 又獻上素祭，從其中取了滿滿的一把，在祭壇上焚燒。這是在早晨的燔祭以外的。

words.note: Specifically for offering sacrifices or tribute.
Reduplication for emphasis.

breakdown.m: measure word for things held in hand

verses.text: 亞倫又宰殺了那為人民作平安祭的公牛和公綿羊；亞倫的兒子把血遞給他，潑在祭壇的周圍。

words.note: Introduces a direct object, similar to 'take' or 'hold'.

verses.text: 他們又把公牛和公綿羊的脂肪、肥尾巴、遮蓋內臟的脂肪、兩個腎和肝葉，

words.note: Introduces a direct object, similar to 'take' or 'hold'.

verses.text: 都放在胸上，亞倫就把脂肪在祭壇上焚燒；

words.note: Introduces a direct object, similar to 'take' or 'hold'.

verses.text: 至於胸和右後腿，亞倫拿來作搖祭，在耶和華面前搖一搖；都是照著摩西吩咐的。

words.note: Indicates direction or purpose when following another verb.
Used between repeated verbs for emphasis or short duration.
Indicates possession or nominalizes the preceding phrase.

verses.text: 亞倫向眾人舉起手，為他們祝福；他獻了贖罪祭、燔祭和平安祭，就下來。

words.note: Common in religious contexts, less so in everyday speech for 'bless'.
Indicates completed action.

verses.text: 摩西和亞倫進了會幕，出來就為眾人祝福；耶和華的榮耀向眾民顯現。

words.note: Indicates completed action.
Lit. 'glorious splendor'.

verses.text: 有火從耶和華面前出來，燒盡了祭壇上的燔祭和脂肪；眾民看見了，就大聲歡呼，俯伏在地。

words.note: Indicates completed action.
Indicates completed action.
